title: Wheel of Fortune contestant jokes he's trapped in a loveless marriage
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

A Wheel Of Fortune contestant in the US has gone viral after his unique way of paying tribute to his ‘rotten’ family.

Rather than the usual simple explanation of who he is, Blair Davis, a trucker from California, decided to spice things up a little with a description of his family.

He told host Pat Sajak: ‘I’ve been trapped in a loveless marriage for the last 12 years to an old battleaxe named Kim.

‘She cursed my life with three stepchildren named Star, RJ and Ryan, and I have one rotten grandson.’

‘No wonder you came here, you just wanted to get away from everybody!’ Pat responded to the frank reponse.

Thankfully after a couple of giggles he admitted he was just kidding, and said: ‘I love them like nobody’s business.’

However, there are some demands of him from the family, and he admitted that his long beard is a must-have for him when it comes to his young grandson.

Thankfully Blair’s family were in on the joke (Picture: NBC)

‘Everytime I threaten to shave it off he gives me a really hard time!’ he laughed.

The jokey clip quickly went viral for his stark sense of humour, which thankfully went down as well as (we hope!) it did at home.

Speaking after it, Blair told Inside Edition: ‘People have been watching the show for so long, and people typically have a template on how they introduce their loved ones, and I thought nah, I didn’t want to do that.

‘It’s a once in a lifetime experience and I wanted to give them a once in a lifetime introduction.’

Well, you certainly succeeded in that, Blair!
